maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves the SMB client directory mappings created for a server.

The Get-SmbMapping cmdlet retrieves the Server Message Block (SMB) client directory mappings created for a server. This can be a mapping from a local drive letter to a remote shared folder, or it can be a mapping without a local path.
Specifies the local path used to map the remote path on this computer.
Specifies the remote path that is accessed from this computer.
Runs the cmdlet as a background job. Use this parameter to run commands that take a long time to complete.

Runs the cmdlet in a remote session or on a remote computer. Enter a computer name or a session object, such as the output of a New-CimSession (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227967) or [Get-CimSession](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227966)cmdlet. The default is the current session on the local computer.

Specifies the maximum number of concurrent operations that can be established to run the cmdlet. If this parameter is omitted or a value of `0` is entered, then Windows PowerShell® calculates an optimum throttle limit for the cmdlet based on the number of CIM cmdlets that are running on the computer. The throttle limit applies only to the current cmdlet, not to the session or to the computer.
Runs the cmdlet as a background job. Use this parameter to run commands that take a long time to complete.

Runs the cmdlet in a remote session or on a remote computer. Enter a computer name or a session object, such as the output of a New-CimSession (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227967) or [Get-CimSession](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227966)cmdlet. The default is the current session on the local computer.
Specifies the local path used to map the remote path on this computer.
Specifies the remote path that is accessed from this computer.

Specifies the maximum number of concurrent operations that can be established to run the cmdlet. If this parameter is omitted or a value of `0` is entered, then Windows PowerShell® calculates an optimum throttle limit for the cmdlet based on the number of CIM cmdlets that are running on the computer. The throttle limit applies only to the current cmdlet, not to the session or to the computer.

The `Microsoft.Management.Infrastructure.CimInstance` object is a wrapper class that displays Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI) objects. The path after the pound sign (`#`) provides the namespace and class name for the underlying WMI object. This cmdlet returns a MSFT_SmbMapping object that represents the mappings created from the SMB client to SMB shares.

command:example.maml:title: --------- Example 1: Get SMB client directory mappings ---------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Get-SmbMapping Status Local Path Remote Path ------ ---------- ----------- OK X: \\Contoso-SO\VMFiles OK Y: \\Contoso-FS\VMS1

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command retrieves the SMB client directory mappings created for the SMB server.

command:example.maml:title: - Example 2: Get SMB client directory mapping for a directory -
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Get-SmbMapping -LocalPath X: | Select-Object -Property * Status : OK LocalPath : X: RemotePath : \\Contoso-SO\VMFiles PSComputerName : CimClass : ROOT/Microsoft/Windows/SMB:MSFT_SmbMapping CimInstanceProperties : {LocalPath, RemotePath, Status} CimSystemProperties : Microsoft.Management.Infrastructure.CimSystemProperties

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command retrieves the SMB client directory mapping for the X: directory created for the SMB server.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates an SMB mapping.
The New-SmbMapping cmdlet creates a Server Message Block (SMB) mapping on the SMB client to an SMB share.
Specifies the local path to which the remote path is mapped.
Specifies the remote path that is accessed from this computer.
Runs the cmdlet as a background job. Use this parameter to run commands that take a long time to complete.

Runs the cmdlet in a remote session or on a remote computer. Enter a computer name or a session object, such as the output of a New-CimSession (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227967) or [Get-CimSession](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227966)cmdlet. The default is the current session on the local computer.
Indicates that SMB compression is requested for the mapped drive if the SMB server supports it.
Indicates that the SMB mapping is global instead of user-specific and is equivalent to using New-SmbGlobalMapping without any explicit allow or deny settings.
Indicates that the connection is made to the home folder of the user.
Specifies the password to be used to connect to the SMB share.
Indicates that this connection is persistent.
Indicates that SMB signing is required for the mapped drive.
Indicates that SMB encryption is required for the mapped drive.
Indicates that the credentials provided should be saved for when a mapping to the same SMB server also is created.
Indicates that the client does not need to trust the server certificate’s issuer in order to connect using SMB over QUIC.

Specifies the maximum number of concurrent operations that can be established to run the cmdlet. If this parameter is omitted or a value of `0` is entered, then Windows PowerShell® calculates an optimum throttle limit for the cmdlet based on the number of CIM cmdlets that are running on the computer. The throttle limit applies only to the current cmdlet, not to the session or to the computer.
Specifies the network transport used by SMB. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
- `TCP:` Use TCP network transport.
- `QUIC:` Use QUIC network transport.
- `None"` Use default transport behavior (first try TCP then try QUIC).
Specifies the user name to use to connect to the SMB share.
Indicates that forced unit access (“write through”) is required and bypasses all OS caches, forcing IO to disk.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Runs the cmdlet as a background job. Use this parameter to run commands that take a long time to complete.

Runs the cmdlet in a remote session or on a remote computer. Enter a computer name or a session object, such as the output of a New-CimSession (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227967) or [Get-CimSession](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227966)cmdlet. The default is the current session on the local computer.
Indicates that SMB compression is requested for the mapped drive if the SMB server supports it.
Indicates that the SMB mapping is global instead of user-specific and is equivalent to using New-SmbGlobalMapping without any explicit allow or deny settings.
Indicates that the connection is made to the home folder of the user.
Specifies the local path to which the remote path is mapped.
Specifies the password to be used to connect to the SMB share.
Indicates that this connection is persistent.
Specifies the remote path that is accessed from this computer.
Indicates that SMB signing is required for the mapped drive.
Indicates that SMB encryption is required for the mapped drive.
Indicates that the credentials provided should be saved for when a mapping to the same SMB server also is created.
Indicates that the client does not need to trust the server certificate’s issuer in order to connect using SMB over QUIC.

Specifies the maximum number of concurrent operations that can be established to run the cmdlet. If this parameter is omitted or a value of `0` is entered, then Windows PowerShell® calculates an optimum throttle limit for the cmdlet based on the number of CIM cmdlets that are running on the computer. The throttle limit applies only to the current cmdlet, not to the session or to the computer.
Specifies the network transport used by SMB. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
- `TCP:` Use TCP network transport.
- `QUIC:` Use QUIC network transport.
- `None"` Use default transport behavior (first try TCP then try QUIC).
Specifies the user name to use to connect to the SMB share.
Indicates that forced unit access (“write through”) is required and bypasses all OS caches, forcing IO to disk.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
This cmdlet returns a MSFT_SmbMapping object that represents the newly created SMB mapping.

command:example.maml:title: --------------- Example 1: Create an SMB mapping ---------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>New-SmbMapping -LocalPath 'X:' -RemotePath '\\Contoso-SO\VMFiles' Status Local Path Remote Path ------ ---------- ----------- OK X: \\Contoso-SO\VMFiles

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command creates an SMB mapping.

maml:description.maml:para: Removes the SMB mapping to an SMB share.
The Remove-SmbMapping cmdlet removes the Server Message Block (SMB) mapping to an SMB share.
Runs the cmdlet as a background job. Use this parameter to run commands that take a long time to complete.

Runs the cmdlet in a remote session or on a remote computer. Enter a computer name or a session object, such as the output of a New-CimSession (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227967) or [Get-CimSession](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227966)cmdlet. The default is the current session on the local computer.
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation.
Removes an SMB global mapping to an SMB share.
Specifies the input object that is used in a pipeline command.
Returns an object representing the item with which you are working. By default, this cmdlet does not generate any output.

Specifies the maximum number of concurrent operations that can be established to run the cmdlet. If this parameter is omitted or a value of `0` is entered, then Windows PowerShell® calculates an optimum throttle limit for the cmdlet based on the number of CIM cmdlets that are running on the computer. The throttle limit applies only to the current cmdlet, not to the session or to the computer.

Indicates that the mapping is removed persistently. The mapping is not re-established when the computer restarts. If you specify this parameter and the mapping is persistent, the mapping is removed persistently. The mapping is not re-established when the computer restarts.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Specifies an array of the local paths associated with the SMB mappings that this cmdlet removes.
Specifies an array of the remote paths of the SMB shares associated with the mappings that this cmdlet removes.
Runs the cmdlet as a background job. Use this parameter to run commands that take a long time to complete.

Runs the cmdlet in a remote session or on a remote computer. Enter a computer name or a session object, such as the output of a New-CimSession (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227967) or [Get-CimSession](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227966)cmdlet. The default is the current session on the local computer.
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation.
Removes an SMB global mapping to an SMB share.
Returns an object representing the item with which you are working. By default, this cmdlet does not generate any output.

Specifies the maximum number of concurrent operations that can be established to run the cmdlet. If this parameter is omitted or a value of `0` is entered, then Windows PowerShell® calculates an optimum throttle limit for the cmdlet based on the number of CIM cmdlets that are running on the computer. The throttle limit applies only to the current cmdlet, not to the session or to the computer.

Indicates that the mapping is removed persistently. The mapping is not re-established when the computer restarts. If you specify this parameter and the mapping is persistent, the mapping is removed persistently. The mapping is not re-established when the computer restarts.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Runs the cmdlet as a background job. Use this parameter to run commands that take a long time to complete.

Runs the cmdlet in a remote session or on a remote computer. Enter a computer name or a session object, such as the output of a New-CimSession (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227967) or [Get-CimSession](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227966)cmdlet. The default is the current session on the local computer.
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation.
Removes an SMB global mapping to an SMB share.
Specifies the input object that is used in a pipeline command.
Specifies an array of the local paths associated with the SMB mappings that this cmdlet removes.
Returns an object representing the item with which you are working. By default, this cmdlet does not generate any output.
Specifies an array of the remote paths of the SMB shares associated with the mappings that this cmdlet removes.

Specifies the maximum number of concurrent operations that can be established to run the cmdlet. If this parameter is omitted or a value of `0` is entered, then Windows PowerShell® calculates an optimum throttle limit for the cmdlet based on the number of CIM cmdlets that are running on the computer. The throttle limit applies only to the current cmdlet, not to the session or to the computer.

Indicates that the mapping is removed persistently. The mapping is not re-established when the computer restarts. If you specify this parameter and the mapping is persistent, the mapping is removed persistently. The mapping is not re-established when the computer restarts.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

command:example.maml:title: ------- Example 1: Remove an SMB mapping to an SMB share -------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Remove-SmbMapping -LocalPath "Y:" Confirm Are you sure you want to perform this action? Performing operation 'Close-Connection' on Target 'Y:,\\Contoso-FS\VMS1'. [Y] Yes [A] Yes to All [N] No [L] No to All [S] Suspend [?] Help (default is "Y"):

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command removes an SMB mapping to an SMB share.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Remove an SMB mapping to an SMB share without confirmation

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command removes an SMB mapping to an SMB share without user confirmation.
